keyword: how many calories can you burn in a sauna
title: How Many Calories Can You Burn in a Sauna?
meta_description: Discover how many calories can you burn in a sauna during a typical session, including factors like duration, body weight, and realistic estimates for calorie expenditure.
h1: How Many Calories Can You Burn in a Sauna?
assumptions: 30-minute session at 80-100°C; average 70 kg adult at rest; based on metabolic rate equivalent to light activity (no exercise).
disclaimer: Calorie burn varies by session length, temperature, humidity, body weight, hydration, and individual metabolism. Not a substitute for exercise; consult a doctor for health concerns.

quick_answer.text: A 30-minute sauna session burns about 100 calories for an average adult.

label_note: Values represent estimated energy expenditure; other nutrients are not applicable to calorie burn.

faqs.q: How many calories can you burn in a sauna per hour?
faqs.a: About 200 calories for an average adult in a 60-minute session.

faqs.q: Does sauna burn fat or just water weight?
faqs.a: Mostly water loss through sweat; actual fat burn is minimal, similar to resting metabolism.

faqs.q: How does body weight affect calories burned in a sauna?
faqs.a: Heavier individuals burn more; e.g., 90 kg person burns ~30% more than 70 kg.

faqs.q: Is sauna calorie burn comparable to exercise?
faqs.a: No—it's low-intensity, equivalent to light sitting; exercise burns far more.

faqs.q: What factors increase calories burned in a sauna?
faqs.a: Longer duration, higher temperature, and larger body size increase burn slightly.
